Job Description:

3M is seeking a Data Analyst Intern for the Health Information Systems Division Summer of 2019 located in (Albany, NY) .

3M Health Information Systems (HIS) is the world leader for innovating the language of health and delivers comprehensive software and consulting services. Working at 3M Health Information Systems you will be helping with today's challenges, while preparing for tomorrow's.

We transform ideas into products and services that help customers add efficiency to their operations and, in turn, deliver better service to patients. The magic of 3M innovation happens when smart, creative people collaborate to break new ground, solve a problem or create a solution that improves or saves lives.

As an intern, you can grow through challenging work, get involved in meaningful projects and receive great coaching from our leaders. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.

The internship position is a temporary position within 3M. Interns typically work a full-time schedule of 40 hours a week throughout a 10-14-week assignment starting in May of 2019.

Note: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. It is in a candidate's best interest to apply early. Most hiring decisions will be made by January 2019.

Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
  • Working with healthcare data to provide actionable solutions to client data requests
  • Working within a team of data analysts to assist with the design and creation of data analyst requests using the Microstrategy BI platform, SQL queries, and Microsoft Excel
  • Performs quality assurance tests on new and existing processes
  • May participate in the design and planning of new features
  • Keeps team members apprised of project status
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Basic Qualifications:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited University
  • Currently possess a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Pursuing a degree in healthcare, data analytics, or data science.
  • Experience with SQL and relational database concepts
  • Experience with the Microstrategy BI tool or other similar data visualization products
  • Experience using Excel to aggregate data and build reports
  • Knowledge of object oriented programming with languages such as C#, Java, or C++ (ASP.NET using Visual Studio preferred)
  • Strong time management skills and the initiative to resolve problems by communicating promptly and driving project forward is required
  • Strong interpersonal skills and judgment in order to interact effectively with a broad spectrum of people, both individually and in groups is required
  • Must be a creative and original thinker
  • Must have the ability to work effectively with close supervision
  • The successful candidate will exhibit professionalism, initiative, sound judgment, dependability, and a strong work ethic
Location: Albany, NY

Relocation: Is authorized

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B, Curricular Practical Training (CPT) or Optional Practical Training (OPT))
